name: harmonica
definition: A small rectangular instrument consisting of a row of free reeds set back in air holes, played by exhaling or inhaling.
description:
The harmonica is a free reed wind instrument used worldwide in many musical genres.

The basic parts of the harmonica are the comb, reed-plates and cover-plates. The comb is the term for the main body of the instrument, which contains the air chambers that cover the reeds.

Reeds are pre-tuned to individual pitches. Tuning may involve changing a reed’s length, the weight near its free end, or the stiffness near its fixed end.

Harmonicas produce their musical sounds from the vibrations of reeds in the harmonica's metal case.

A harmonica is played by using the mouth to direct air into or out of one or more holes along a mouthpiece. Behind each hole is a chamber containing at least one reed.

An important technique in performance is bending: causing a drop in pitch by making embouchure adjustments.

Harmonicas are used in blues music, folk music, rock and roll music, and pop music. A special type of harmonica, the chromatic harmonica, is used in jazz and classical music.

related.definition: A portable wind instrument with a small keyboard and free metal reeds that sound when air is forced past them by pleated bellows operated by the player.
A musical instrument similar to a large concertina, especially popular in Latin America.
A small instrument with bellows like an accordion but with buttons in place of keys.
